Activity2.Description: ENTERPRISE FACULTY FELLOWSHIPS - A PROGRAM FOR BUSINESS FACULTY AT SELECTED UNIVERSITIES IN CENTRAL ASIA TO FURTHER DEVELOP THEIR TEACHING SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND COURSE CURRICULUM. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, THE ORGANIZATION HELD TWO FACULTY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS IN CENTRAL ASIA. INCLUDED IN PROGRAM COSTS ARE EXPENSES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FACULTY TRAINING EVENT TO BE HELD FEBRUARY 2011 IN KAZAKHSTAN.

Activity3.Description: ENTERPRISE INTERN FELLOWSHIPS - A PROGRAM TO PROVIDE ENTERPRISE STUDENT FELLOWS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO GAIN VALUABLE WORK EXPERIENCE WITHIN CENTRAL ASIA - AS WELL AS VOCATIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND CULTURAL EXPERIENCE IN THE USA AND OTHER COUNTRIES THAT SERVE AS POSITIVE EXAMPLES OF DEMOCRATIC OPEN-MARKET ECONOMIES. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, THE ORGANIZATION AWARDED 10 INTERN FELLOWSHIPS WITH COMPANIES IN CENTRAL ASIA. PROGRAM COSTS INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT COSTS FOR A USA-BASED INTERNSHIP PROGRAM PLANNED FOR FISCAL YEAR 2011.

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The U.S. - CENTRAL ASIA EDUCATION FOUNDATION (the Foundation) was incorporated in May 2007 to further the work of the Central Asian-American Enterprise Fund (the Fund) The Foundation's mission is to encourage and assist development and growth of a vibrant open-market private business sector in Central Asia by: supporting the quality of - and affordable access to - Western business know-how and practices at selected institutions of higher learning in the region that have adopted Western curricula and teaching methods; providing opportunities for educational, vocational, and cultural experience in countries that serve as positive examples of an open market economy operating within a democratic environment; and, promoting other activities that will generate a favorable environment in Central Asia for private business to succeed and an entrepreneurial spirit to thrive.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The U.S. - CENTRAL ASIA EDUCATION FOUNDATION (the Foundation) was incorporated in May 2007 to further the work of the Central Asian-American Enterprise Fund (the Fund) The Foundation's mission is to encourage and assist development and growth of a vibrant open-market private business sector in Central Asia by: supporting the quality of - and affordable access to - Western business know-how and practices at selected institutions of higher learning in the region that have adopted Western curricula and teaching methods; providing opportunities for educational, vocational, and cultural experience in countries that serve as positive examples of an open market economy operating within aa democratic environment; and, promoting other activities that will generate a favorable environment in Central Asia for private business to succeed and an entrepreneurial spirit to thrive.
IRS990.Description: ENTERPRISE STUDENT FELLOWSHIPS - A FINANCIAL NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM FOR ACADEMICALLY QUALIFIED CITIZEN RESIDENTS OF CENTRAL ASIA TO OBTAIN AN UNDERGRADUATE BUSINESS EDUCATION, THAT DUE TO FINANCIAL HARDSHIP WOULD OTHERWISE NOT HAVE BEEN ABLE TO OBTAIN SUCH AN EDUCATION. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, THE ORGANIZATION AWARDED 31 NEW FELLOWSHIPS AND RENEWED 93 STUDENT FELLOWSHIPS FOR THE 2010 ACADEMIC YEAR. PROGRAM COSTS INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT, RECRUITMENT, SELECTION, MONITORING AND FELLOWSHIP AWARDS. STUDENT FELLOWSHIP AWARDS ACCOUNT FOR $572,417 OF THE COST OF THIS PROGRAM SERVICE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The federal and State of New Hampshire tax returns of the Foundation are subject to examination, generally for three years after they are filed. The Foundation does not believe that there are any uncertain tax positions taken in preparation of the tax returns that would impact these financial statements.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.Region: Russia and the Newly Independent States
AcctsActvsOutUSTable.TypeOfActivitiesConducted: GRANTMAKING TO RECIPIENTS IN REGION, DIRECTLY RELATED TO ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY TAX EXEMPT PURPOSE
AcctsActvsOutUSTable.SpecificServicesProvided: THE U.S.- CENTRAL ASIA EDUCATION FOUNDATION PROVIDES THREE PROGRAMS IN THE REGION: (1) ENTERPRISE STUDENT FELLOWSHIPS, A FINANCIAL NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM FOR CITIZEN-RESIDENT STUDENTS OF KAZAKHSTAN, KYRGYZSTAN, TAJIKISTAN, TURKMENISTAN, AND UZBEKISTAN TO OBTAIN AN UNDERGRADUATE BUSINESS DEGREE AT THE AMERICAN UNIVERSITY OF CENTRAL ASIA ("AUCA" /BISHKEK, KG) AND THE KAZAKHSTAN INSTITUTE OF MANAGEMENT ECONOMICS AND STRATEGIC RESEARCH ("KINEP"/ALMATY, KZ); (2) ENTERPRISE INTERN FELLOWSHIPS: A PROGRAM FOR SELECT ENTERPRISE STUDENTS TO APPLY THEIR BUSINESS EDUCATION AND GAIN RELATED WORK EXPERIENCE; AND, (3) ENTERPRISE FACULTY FELLOWSHIPS: A PROGRAM FOR BUSINESS FACULTY TO DEVELOP THEIR TEACHING SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND COURSE CURRICULUM. REFER TO 990 PAGE 2, PART III LINES 4A - 4E FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THESE PROGRAM SERVICES.

GrantsToIndOutsideUS.TypeOfAssistance: FINANCIAL NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS FOR ACADEMICALLY QUALIFIED CITIZEN RESIDENTS OF CENTRAL ASIA TO OBTAIN AN UNDERGRADUATE BUSINESS EDUCATION, GRANTS FOR BUSINESS FACULTY TO DEVELOP TEACHING SKILLS, AND STUDENT FELLOW PROGRAMS
GrantsToIndOutsideUS.Region: Russia and the Newly Independent States
GrantsToIndOutsideUS.MannerOfCashDisbursement: PAYMENTS DISBURSED THROUGH THE AMERICAN COUNCILS

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants Outside the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2: Scholarships are administered through the American Councils for International Education. TUITION AND UNIVERSITY FEES ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE SCHOOL AND NOT TO THE STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: EFFECTIVE JANUARY 2010, THE ORGANIZATION CONTRACTED WITH HOLLY BURNS TO PROVIDE ANNUAL ACCOUNTING SERVICES OF 240 HOURS AT A RATE OF $50/HOUR. SERVICES EXCEEDING 240 HOURS ARE CONSIDERED DONATED SERVICES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO COMMITTEES OTHER THAN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT AND IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE IT IS FILED.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO EMPLOYEES THEREFORE THERE IS NO SUCH PROCESS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVILABLE ON THEIR WEBSITE (www.us-caef.com). OTHER DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VII, SEC B, LINE 1, COLUMN B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONTRACTED SERVICES PROVIDED BY AMERICAN COUNCIL FOR INTERNATIONAL EDUCATION INCLUDE ADMINISTRATION OF, AND DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS FOR, THE FOUNDATION'S STUDENT FELLOWSHIPS, STUDENT INTERNSHIPS, AND FACULTY TRAINING.

AddressUS.AddressLine1: C/O HOLLY BURNS 124 U STREET NW

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: PROMOTE BUSINESS AND ECONOMIC development IN CENTRAL ASIA
